function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Lack of adherence to preventive measures such as self-isolation and isolation of infected patients","Lack of hygiene measures and precautions during diagnosis and clinical care","Failure to follow who recommendations for avoiding close contact with infected individuals and animals","Transmission of the virus through respiratory droplets released via coughs and sneezes","Longevity of the virus on different surfaces, increasing the risk of indirect transmission through touch","Asymptomatic spread of the virus before symptoms appear, leading to undetected transmission","Coronavirus attacks the respiratory tract and infects humans, mammals, and birds, causing mild to severe symptoms","Covid-19 has fast spread globally, causing a public health emergency of international concern","No standard vaccine or cure for covid-19","Novel approaches required to improve air quality monitoring","Inadequate monitoring of indoor air quality and pollutant levels","Lack of knowledge on airborne virus transmissions in built environments","Inadequate integration of disinfection and purification techniques in building design","Reluctance to use elevators in high-rise buildings due to disease transmission concerns","The potential for ongoing covid-19 pandemic","Uncertainty about the long-term effects and changes in the built environment","Lack of flexibility and responsiveness in addressing pandemics","Insufficient preparation for future pandemics","Increased density in urban areas leading to higher risk of contagious disease spread","Increased population density in cities","Historical pandemics like cholera, typhoid, tuberculosis, and the third plague pandemic have influenced the design and infrastructure of the built environment, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases","The current health crisis, particularly the covid-19 pandemic, has directly impacted urban planning and architecture, necessitating the development of built environments with enhanced security measures to prevent the spread of infections and diseases"]}
